results.title: Jack Davey
results.creator_credit: George Whaley, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
In 1954, radio personality Jack Davey was the most famous person in Australia. During the same year Jack entered the first around Australia car race, the Redex Trial. On the road in north Western Australia his car fell apart under the strain. He was disqualified from the race after taking a short cut and missing a checkpoint. Disillusioned but not defeated, Jack decided he was to be the first back in Sydney regardless of whether he was still in the race or not.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Whaley, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders

results.title: Clyde Fenton
results.creator_credit: John Power, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
Clyde Fenton was a skilled aviator and brilliant surgeon. Together with fellow doctor, Cecil Cook, the Northern Territories Chief Medical Officer, he pioneered the creation of the Flying Doctor Service. The Doctor Service was a great medical success but ran foul of the Department of Civil Aviation. Fenton battled with the Department and he soon found himself in court fighting for his right to fly and carry on with his work. Fenton soon became a folk hero to the people of the Northern Territory.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Power, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders

results.title: Betty Cuthbert
results.creator_credit: Kathy Mueller, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders, Coote and Carroll and Roadshow Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings history to life. Betty Cuthbert, the “Golden Girl”, held a very special place in the affections of the sporting world because of her immense courage, optimism and innate modesty. Betty competed in 3 Olympic Games during her 13 year career as the world’s greatest female runner.

results.title: Lottie Lyell
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Lottie Lyell was one of Australia’s most successful actresses. Although she often played the damsel in distress in her early films, Lottie was no helpless heroine in real life. As well as starring in her films, she worked behind the cameras as script writer, art director, costume designer, editor and business manager. She was part of an excellent team with Raymond Longford, Australia’s best known silent film director with whom she had a long and enduring relationship.

results.title: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: A three part series in which John Pilger explores aspects of Australia’s history from first settlement, through its involvement in wars right through to today’s society, and looks at the plight of the Aborigines throughout Australian history.
results.title_for_label: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger

group_works.title: Secrets
group_works.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)

results.title: Secrets
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
Part two of John Pilger’s personal view of Australian history and identity. This part is about the past catching up with the present. Behind the Bicentennial ballyhoo, the original Australians are treated as badly as many blacks in South Africa; and, for an increasing number of whites, the old egalitarian ways no longer have a place in a media conscious “lucky country” which now produces fine wines, films and thousands of overnight millionaires whilst many of its children are living in poverty.

group_siblings.title: Other people's wars

results.title: Other people's wars
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
The final episode of a three part series which explores aspects of Australia’s history. This part shows how Australians fight mostly against people with whom they have no quarrel and who offer them no threat of invasion. From the Boxer Rebellion in China to the Boer War in Africa, to the disaster in Vietnam, Australians have paid a unique blood sacrifice to appease a great protector.

results.title: Heroes Unsung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
Part One of a three part series which explores aspects of Australia’s history. In this part, John Pilger traces the history of Australian immigration, from a personal perspective, from the horrors of the First Fleet through to the “White Australia” policy and the post-war “Populate or Perish” program. He challenges Australia’s treasured stereotypes and self-image and instead shows the great hardships suffered by certain groups, namely convicts, immigrants, women and Aborigines, in the process of building the nation.

results.title: Thomas and the jet engine
results.creator_credit: David Mitton, Britt Allcroft and Britt Allcroft Co
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Thomas the tank engine & friends”.
It’s full steam ahead for Thomas, the little blue engine and his special friends Gordon, Henry, James, Percy, Edward, Toby, Annie and Clarabel and their boss, the Fat Controller. The stories are narrated by Michael Angelis.
